alert.note: Alert for Yoakum (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 29 at 9:58PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Yoakum County. * WHEN...Until 1030 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 951 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated light to moderate rain from slow-moving thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing over much of the advisory area. Radar indicates between 1 and 2 inches of rain has fallen generally from Denver City to near Plains, with nearly 3 inches 7 miles southwest of Plains. - Although storms are weakening, up to an additional 0.25 inch of rain is possible over the area through 1030 PM. This additional rain will prolong minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Denver City and Plains. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially alert for standing water on roads at nighttime and avoid driving through flooding.
